column1: dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Calendar disappears after reboot in Android 8.1,[],"BC Version: 2.0 (installed via F-Droid)
my Birthday Calendar App shows birthdays twice or sometimes three times. I have an HTC10 with Android 8. I have already disabled all accounts in the Account-Filter tab with no success.
Has anyone a solution or is this a bug in this app for newer Android versions?"
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,FR: Adaptive icon,[],"Api 26 introduced adaptive icons where background and foreground are two different images.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,Events in calendar before start year,[],"by email:
wollte fragen, ob es Absicht ist, dass die Geburtstage immer nur rückwirkend für 3 Jahre angezeigt werden?

Was mir noch aufgefallen ist, ist dass die Einträge auch die Jahre vor dem eigentlichen Jahrestag angezeigt werden. Beispiel: Geburtag 20.10.2017 - Eintrag wird aber auch am 20.10.2016 und die Jahre davor angezeigt obwohl noch nicht geboren.
Wenn ich beim Geburtstag keine Jahreszahl eingebe verstehe ich das ja noch, aber mit Jahreszahl sollte das nicht passieren.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Hide age from title when year is not set,[],Fix #79

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Is a new calender created or not?,[],"""Birthday Calendar is the first implementation to really display all contact birthdays automatically in your standard Android calendar without hassle.""
It sounds to me that it will add the events to a exitsing calendar."
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,"Link name to contact, please",[],"I find the age underlined and creating an active link as a two digit phone number, which apparently doesn't make any sense.
Instead, i'd appreciate a lot if the name was linked to the contact so i can easily call and wish a happy birthday."

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,Cannot create account on Android 7,[],"Since I updated to Android 7 (Linage OS), Birthhday Adapter doesn't sync anymore. I cannot add an account from the app, the calendar vor system settings -> accounts. No error message, it just doesn't happen."
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,"Reminder set at a certain time, rings at a different one",[],"Hi,
if I try to set a reminder for my birthdays, the reminder is set to a wrong and strange time.
but on the calendar app the reminder is set to
and it rings at 18:00 (I use a 24 hour clock and my time-zone is GMT+1).
If I set 10:00, the values become -10hours and so on.
If I try to change the reminder from the calendar app, the drop-down suggests me (apart from the -9 hours value) the default values from 0 minutes to 1 week.
Running Android 6.0.1, Birthday Adapter 2.0 (19) from F-Droid.
At disposal for further info, thanks in advance, bye!

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,Limit choice in color picker,[],The current color picker gives too many possibilities. It is very hard to choose an identical color. Could you use a color picker that ofers only a selection of https://www.google.com/design/spec/style/color.html which are conform the Material Design?
I think we need a new icon for this app in the material design.
Here is good idea from a FLOOS-theme.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Feature request: add contact profile picture to events,[],Hello,
I've been using your app and it's great, especially since it's the only one I found that displays contact age (even native Google calendar doesn't support this!)
Would be great if contact photos were displayed next to the events on the calendar.

Not sure if this can be done, I've seen there's an option to specify icon URLs if you're using the [calendar gadgets](https://developers.google.com/google-apps/calendar/gadgets/event/) method for creating events, not sure if it can be used in this scenario.
Google birthdays take the picture from Google contacts, but I guess this app can use pictures stored locally in the phone contacts.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,How to add an appointment to calendar (on Lollipop)?,[],I am new to OC.
After having installed it on Android Lollipop I created at first a new calendar ""test"".
Now how can I add an appointment?
In Menu on the upper left side there is only an ""About"" entry.

I have the following problem, then that puts the site of a ntp server and do the ""consultation"" and ""detailed inquiry"" it returns me the correct time, but when I click ""check and change"" message of ""Error Appears generic "", I use the version 4.0.3 of Android.

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Picker für Erinnerungszeiten fehlerhaft,[],Wenn die Zeiten der Erinnerung geändert werden, indem auf die Stunden oder Minuten geklickt und per Tastatur ein neuer Wert eingegeben wird, wird die Änderung nicht gespeichert.
Eine Änderung der Zeiten durch Benutzung der Pfeile (Stunden/Minuten inkrementieren/dekrementieren) wird korrekt übernommen.
Beobachtet auf einem Samsung Galaxy SIII mit Android 4.3.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,generic error,[],Whenever I try to query and set time,  I get generic error and nothing happens.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Contacts from Fruux creates no events,[],**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Have all your contacts in [Fruux](https://fruux.com) and make them available on your phone via [their app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.fruux.android)
3. Disable Privacy Guard for Birthday Adapter
4. Start Birthday Adapter (and if it doesn't start automatically, start syncing)
I expect my contacts birthdays to appear in the Birthday calendar.
No events appear in the calendar.
**What version of the product are you using? On what operating system?**

I/ActivityManager(  953): Start proc org.birthdayadapter.free:calendar for service org.birthdayadapter.free/org.birthdayadapter.service.CalendarSyncAdapterService: pid=31597 uid=10087 gids={50087, 1028}

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,Reminders spam (too many unrequested reminders for birthday events),[],I have configured Birthday adapter for only one calendar (the google one) with only one reminder per event: (at 11 am at the day of the event).
The problem is I am practically getting 3 or 4 reminders around 12 pm, besides the one at 11 am.
I tried reinstalling, reconfiguring, but no success. It is really annoying.
I have a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 with Android 4.3.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Ages (in parenthesis) not updating/not removed after removing year from contact's birthday,[],Hi, great app!
A bug - I removed the year and left just the month and day in the birthday - but the app is still showing the 'age' in parenthesis.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,not all birthdays are shown in the calendar,[],Not all birthdays are shown in the calendar, however there are on the phone as they are shown in birthdroid.

- contacts coming from a Kolab account (This may contribute to the problem. I am not sure though. I have compared the Kolab files for one contact which is displayed and for one which isn't displayed and their structure is identical.)
- I checked the free and the paid version on the Google store

I tried to extract log data via adb (as I have seen in the source code that a lot of interesting information is logged) but logging of the adapter seems to be disabled. Is there a runtime switch? I also tried to delete and restore all contact data multiple times. What I found interesting is that roughly the same contacts were not shown. I can help with debugging (but I don't have the Android SDK installed).
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,Let the user choose to only show first name in the calendar entries,[],Let the user choose to only show first name in the calendar entries
As it is now, both first- and sir-name are shown. It would also be cool if we could choose to use screen name (""show as"") or nick name.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,reminder not working,[],Hello, i have a bug:
I was buyed birthday adapter, and installed birthday jb workaround, after reboot, i don't have the reminder...

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Setting the time of reminders,[],I have set Reminder 1 to remind me of my contacts' birthdays ""1 day before at 09:00"". However, in my Google Calendar, the reminders for these birthdays show 15 hours. I would like to understand what these 15 hours mean, taking into account that in my Google calendar, the default reminder time is set on ""None"", and that I haven't heard either of the reminders. Thank you!
Birthday adapter"" why the name? Why Adapter? Because of syncadapter?
The word adapter is cryptic with that meaning for most common Android user. You might want to think of something else. Sorry to say so, but that's what I think.
Besides one calendar showing all the birthdays, there are literally thousands more showing up as it can be seen in the attached screenshot
I'm using cyanogemod on a nexus 4
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,open,Linked Contacts not showing in Calendar,[],Android 4.2.2 Samsung Galaxy S II
Goto Contacts, pick a contact ""A"", click on ""Link"" (""Verknüpfung"" in German), link the account to some other contact ""B"". Then contact ""B""'s birthday wont be shown in the calendar anymore.
A linked contact is like a sub-contact. E.g. you can put your friend's girl-friend there. The contact is accessible only via the main contact ""A"". Still, it is useful to show their birthdays!
You can contact me for more information.
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Erstellt hunderte Kalender,[],Ich hoffe, es passt, wenn ich Deutsch schreibe, dann hab ich's schneller erklärt:

Die App funktioniert, erstellt aber neben dem Kalender in der ausgewählten Farbe, der die Geburtstage enthält, noch so viele weitere leere Kalender, dass ich die Liste nicht durchscrollen kann und beispielsweise Kalenderwidgets abstürzen. Meine Kontakte sind auf einem CalDAV-Server und werden via ""CalDAV-Sync"" synchronisiert. Vielleicht hat es etwas damit zu tun...
dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Installed on 2.1?,[Label(name=""bug"")]","Got an email saying it does not work on Android 2.1.
Android OS should refuse to install BA in the first place because it has minSdk 8 (Android 2.2).
Need to investigate. Are there other Manifest properties that need to be set to prevent it from installing on Android < 2.2?

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Calendar app does not allow ""Change only this event"" for events from calendars with CalendarContract.ACCOUNT_TYPE_LOCAL",[],"Bug report copied here from upstream AOSP: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=58779
As can be seen in [1] Android's default calendar app does not allow to change single instances of an event when the event is not synced (_SYNC_ID is empty).
As local calendars created by CalendarContract.ACCOUNT_TYPE_LOCAL are never synchronized, the option will never be available.
Fix: Don't check for syncId for events from calendars with ACCOUNT_TYPE_LOCAL.
Bug report from my app Offline Calendar: https://github.com/dschuermann/offline-calendar/issues/14

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Parsing contact notes,[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","There is not always a possibility to use custom events for a contact (for example my phone's default contact editor does not allow custom events; also my sync server does not want to sync such fields). As a workaround I have always used contact notes to store information about specific events (and it was more or less supported by EboBirthday).
It would be great to implement parsing of the contact notes for entries like ""event_name: event_date"" (without ""s), where the specific event names would need to be configurable from gui.

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Dates are parsed incorrectly (Motorola Defy),[Label(name=""Priority-High""), Label(name=""bug""), Label(name=""imported"")]","_Original author: d.lai...@gmail.com (January 07, 2013 20:22:37)_
On my phone I'm using birthday-adapter on my Owncloud address book synced with CalDav-Sync. However, the dates of the generated events do not match the birthdays at all.
This is probably due to my phone using timestamps as a date format (see [1]).

For example the date 1989-12-24 becomes September 4 in the calendar. With another contact editor [2] the birthday field contains 627943569622. Divide this by 1000 and you get a Unix timestamp that matches the birthday (and the time seems to match the time I entered it -- for whatever reason).
I would suggest to either auto-detect the date format or make it configurable.

dschuermann/birthday-adapter,closed,Feature request: add an option to specify an existing calendar,[Label(name=""Priority-Medium""), Label(name=""bug""), Label(name=""imported"")]","_Original author: bevendor...@gmail.com (April 02, 2012 23:41:48)_

Long have I searched for an app that syncs my contact's birthdays with my calendar and now I have found this app. I had another app for this purpose before, but it stopped working properly, so I'm glad to have an alternative and Birthday Adapter is great. It's simple, it's beautiful (most birthday apps look awful) and it's functional.
But for me it needs one more feature to be perfect and that is an option to specify an existing calendar to sync the birthdays to.

The reason is that I need to sync the birthday calendar with my notebook and my desktop PC. I don't know how it's on "plain" Android, but on my HTC I'm not able to sync the birthday calendar with my Google calendars.
An option for syncing the birthday calendar with Google or using an existing calendar would be an awesome feature.
